subject: RE: [junit] C unit testing framework?
msgSnippet: Hi David, Fair enough. Thinking about it, my successes with using C++ to test C all involved developers who already used C++  and liked it better than C.

> > Is there any obstacle to using a C++ framework to test the 
> C=
 code? If

> you need 
> > to run tests on an embedded platform it would depend on wh=
at 
> > cross-compilers are available.

ramework, my own current favorites are

bedded component and Google test for 
> > desktop apps. CPPUnitLite is also=
 a good choice if you expect to 
> > modify the framework, because it's sma=
ll - and expects you 
> to modify 
> > it.

nces between JUnit and any C/C++ 
> framework are

 differences between the individual 
> frameworks, so

ve a lot to unlearn/learn no matter what the choice.
